alert.note: Alert for Clay (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 18 at 6:46AM CDT until June 18 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT FOR NOXUBEE...NORTHERN KEMPER...EASTERN OKTIBBEHA...SOUTHEASTERN CLAY AND LOWNDES COUNTIES... At 645 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Oktoc to near Brooksville to near Scooba, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Brooksville, Crawford and Sessums around 650 AM CDT. Artesia, Deerbrook and Cooksville around 655 AM CDT. Bent Oak and Tibbee around 700 AM CDT. Bigbee Valley around 705 AM CDT. Columbus and Waverly around 710 AM CDT. Columbus AFB around 715 AM CDT. Steens and Kolola Springs around 720 AM CDT. Caledonia around 725 AM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
